message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.RO 

The paper discusses the development of a formal objective criterion for extracting the right state representation out of observations, which is a key problem in reinforcement learning. This makes it highly relevant to the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also proposes a learning algorithm, which falls under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and Bayesian networks suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of control systems (cs.SY) and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper's focus on learning agents suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of robotics (cs.RO).
